src:
Bandelj zaskrbljen zaradi težav Televizije Koper-Capodistria
02 Nov 2019, 16:14 by STA

Walter Bandelj, predsednik ene od krovnih organizacij slovenske narodne skupnosti v Italiji, Sveta slovenskih organizacij (SSO), je danes izrazil zaskrbljenost zaradi napovedane ukinitve satelitskega oddajanja italijanskih programov Televizije Koper-Capodristria čez teden dni.



Walter Bandelj Foto: Jurij Paljk/STA

TRST > Kot član odbora komisije za programske vsebine Radiotelevizije Slovenija, namenjene Slovencem v sosednjih državah, je v zapisu izpostavil, da bo ukinitev oddajanja za "zamejce v Italiji povzročila veliko škodo, saj v Italiji nimamo kabelske mreže kot v ostalih državah".
Pozval je, da se to ne bi zgodilo, "saj bi ta mrk izključil gledalce programov slovenske manjšine v Italiji", pomenilo pa bi tudi izbris njihovega delovanja, ki je za matično državo Slovenijo še toliko bolj pomembno.
Zapis je naslovil na ministra za Slovence v zamejstvu in po svetu Petra Jožefa Česnika, premierja Marjana Šarca ter predsednika omenjene komisije Janka Malleja in generalnega direktorja RTV Slovenije Igorja Kadunca.
Uredništva programov Televizije Koper-Capodistria v italijanskem jeziku so minuli teden pozvala italijansko vlado, slovenska politična telesa, predstavnike italijanske narodne skupnosti v Sloveniji in na Hrvaškem ter Radiotelevizijo Slovenija, da jim zagotovijo nadaljevanje satelitskega oddajanja programov.
Opozorili so, da bo 9. novembra zaradi izčrpanja finančnih sredstev, ki jih je Italija namenjala sprejemanju njihovega signala na satelitu Hotbird, prekinjeno satelitsko oddajanje televizijskih programov TV Koper-Capodistria v italijanskem jeziku.
Med drugim so izpostavili, da je "prenehanje tega načina oddajanja naših programov - edinega, ki lahko zagotovi prisotnost našega signala na celotnem avtohtonem območju poselitve italijanske manjšine v Istri, na Reki in v Dalmaciji, a tudi v obmejnih italijanskih pokrajinah - hud udarec za italijansko narodno skupnost, živečo na območju, kjer oddaje Televizije in Radia Koper-Capodistria že desetletja predstavljajo nenadomestljivo sredstvo širjenja italijanskega jezika in kulture ter pomembno oporno točko pri ohranjanju identitete in čuta pripadnosti Italijanov, ki so 'ostali'".
text:
Bandelj worried about the problems of Koper-Capodistria Television
02 Nov 2019, 15:14 by STA

Walter Bandelj, chairman of one of the umbrella organizations of the Slovene national community in Italy, the Council of Slovenian Organizations (SSO), expressed concern over the announced abolition of satellite broadcasting of Italian programs by Koper-Capodristria Television in a week.



Walter Bandelj Photo: Yuri Paljk / STA

TRIESTE> As a member of the committee for the Radio and Television Programs Slovenia commission aimed at Slovenes in neighboring countries, he noted in the record that the abolition of broadcasting for "foreigners in Italy will cause great harm, since we do not have a cable network in Italy like in other countries".
He urged that this would not happen "because this eclipse would exclude viewers of Slovene minority programs in Italy" and would mean the erasure of their activities, which is all the more important for the mother country of Slovenia.
The letter was addressed to the Minister for Slovenians Abroad and Peter Jozef Cesnik, Prime Minister Marjan Sarac, and the President of the said Commission, Janko Mallej, and Igor Kadunec, Director General of RTV Slovenia.
Last week, the editors of the Koper-Capodistria Television programs in the Italian language called on the Italian government, Slovenian political bodies, representatives of the Italian national community in Slovenia and Croatia, and Radio Television Slovenia to assure them of the continued broadcasting of the programs.
They warned that on November 9th, because of the exhaustion of the financial resources allocated by Italy to receive their signal on the Hotbird satellite, the Italian-language satellite broadcasting of TV Koper-Capodistria would be interrupted.
Among other things, they emphasized that "stopping this mode of broadcasting our programs - the only one that can guarantee the presence of our signal in the entire autochthonous settlement area of the Italian minority in Istria, Rijeka and Dalmatia, but also in the Italian border regions - is a severe blow to the Italian a national community living in an area where TV and Radio Koper-Capodistria have for decades been an indispensable means of disseminating the Italian language and culture, and an important starting point in maintaining the identity and sense of belonging of Italians who have 'remained'. "
